name: Vertex-Mistral-Basic-Chat
description: This establishes a basic flow for custom endpoint vertexAI calls with formatted request/response logic for mistral models (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

data.description: Get chat inputs from the Playground.

node.description: Get chat inputs from the Playground.

code.name: code
code.value:
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

files.info: Files to be sent with the message.
files.name: files

input_value.info: Message to be passed as input.
input_value.name: input_value

session_id.info: The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.
session_id.name: session_id

should_store_message.info: Store the message in the history.
should_store_message.name: should_store_message

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI
import json


class JSONChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "JSON Chat Output"
    description = "Parses JSON to extract the text after 'Output:' and display a chat message."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "JSONChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="JSON Input",
            info="JSON to be parsed and the 'Output' value extracted.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            # Parse the input_value which is expected to be a JSON string
            parsed_message = json.loads(self.input_value)
            
            # Extract the "Output" value from the predictions string
            prediction = parsed_message['predictions'][0]
            
            # Find the index where "Output:" starts
            output_start = prediction.find("Output:")
            if output_start != -1:
                # Extract the actual text after "Output:\n"
                output = prediction[output_start + len("Output:"):].strip()
            else:
                output = "Output not found in the prediction"
            
            # Build the message with the extracted output
            message = Message(
                text=output,
                sender=self.sender,
                sender_name=self.sender_name,
                session_id=self.session_id,
            )
            
            # Store the message if required
            if (
                self.session_id
                and isinstance(message, Message)
                and isinstance(message.text, str)
                and self.should_store_message
            ):
                store_message(
                    message,
                    flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
                )
                self.message.value = message

            self.status = message
            return message

        except json.JSONDecodeError:
            return Message(
                text="Invalid JSON input", 
                sender=self.sender,
                sender_name=self.sender_name,
                session_id=self.session_id,
            )
        except KeyError:
            return Message(
                text="Missing 'predictions' key in JSON", 
                sender=self.sender,
                sender_name=self.sender_name,
                session_id=self.session_id,
            )

from axiestudio.base.data.utils import IMG_FILE_TYPES, TEXT_FILE_TYPES
from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FileInput, MessageTextInput, MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"
    name = "ChatInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            value="",
            info="Message to be passed as input.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_USER,
            info="Type of sender.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_USER,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        FileInput(
            name="files",
            display_name="Files",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES + IMG_FILE_TYPES,
            info="Files to be sent with the message.",
            advanced=True,
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
            files=self.files,
        )

        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI
import json


class JSONChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "JSON Chat Output"
    description = "Parses JSON to extract the text after 'Output:' and display a chat message."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "JSONChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="JSON Input",
            info="JSON to be parsed and the 'Output' value extracted.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        try:
            # Parse the input_value which is expected to be a JSON string
            parsed_message = json.loads(self.input_value)
            
            # Extract the "Output" value from the predictions string
            prediction = parsed_message['predictions'][0]
            
            # Find the index where "Output:" starts
            output_start = prediction.find("Output:")
            if output_start != -1:
                # Extract the actual text after "Output:\n"
                output = prediction[output_start + len("Output:"):].strip()
            else:
                output = "Output not found in the prediction"
            
            # Build the message with the extracted output
            message = Message(
                text=output,
                sender=self.sender,
                sender_name=self.sender_name,
                session_id=self.session_id,
            )
            
            # Store the message if required
            if (
                self.session_id
                and isinstance(message, Message)
                and isinstance(message.text, str)
                and self.should_store_message
            ):
                store_message(
                    message,
                    flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
                )
                self.message.value = message

            self.status = message
            return message

        except json.JSONDecodeError:
            return Message(
                text="Invalid JSON input", 
                sender=self.sender,
                sender_name=self.sender_name,
                session_id=self.session_id,
            )
        except KeyError:
            return Message(
                text="Missing 'predictions' key in JSON", 
                sender=self.sender,
                sender_name=self.sender_name,
                session_id=self.session_id,
            )
